page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: In this block the southern edge of the City of Oxford merges into the countryside. The local economy is dominated by the {Austin Rover}works at Cowley. Many who work there live in the two large council estates of Blackbird Leys and Rose Hill or in the nearby villages of Littlemore,Sandford and Kennington. The Oxford ring-road passes from East to West and the road from Oxford to Henley passes from North to South. So too does the river Thames. All kinds of pleasure boat use the river, held up only by the need to negotiate two locks at Iffley and Sandford. l00 years ago the whole area was rural. Iffley and Cowley, now part of Oxford, were villages in their own right. Today Littlemore and Kennington stand poised to be swallowed up by Oxford's urban sprawl.
